item.title: Jefferies says buy this pharmaceutical play, sees more than 100% upside from here
item.description: This pharmaceutical company's recent drug developments could spell more gains ahead, according to Jefferies.

item.title: Undersea cables between Germany and Finland severed—sparking suspicion of sabotage

item.title: Their student loans should have been canceled already. What happens under Trump?
Fintech unicorns are watching Klarna's debut for signs of when IPO window will reopen
item.description: Financial technology unicorns aren't in a rush to go public even after buy now, pay later firm Klarna filed for a U.S. IPO.

item.title: Swiss watch exports fall again amid plummeting demand in China
item.description: Swiss watch exports are on track to post an overall decline in 2024 for the first time since the pandemic disrupted yearly sales in 2020.

item.title: Bond yields slip, stock futures lose ground as Russia updates nuclear doctrine
Corporate bond spreads hit a record low last week. It may be a sign of a bubble.

item.title: Germany's Thyssenkrupp pops 8% after narrowing net loss and booking $1 billion impairment charge
item.description: Thyssenkrupp on Tuesday reported a 1-billion-euro ($1 billion) impairment on its struggling steel division.

item.title: What does Spirit Airlines’ bankruptcy filing mean for travelers?
item.description: The airline has lost more than $2.5 billion since the beginning of 2020 while also racking up mounting debt.

item.title: The SEC’s Gary Gensler must refrain from doing more harm to crypto on his way out the door
item.description: Gensler’s a goner. His campaign of of crypto antagonism must stop right now.
